solution.text:
To find if a polynomial is a factor of another polynomial
We divide the polynomial and check if the remainder obtained is 0
\(\require{enclose}\begin{array}{r} x+_{l}_ \\[-3pt] x^2+_{j}_x+_{k}_\enclose{longdiv}{x^3 + _{{j+l}}_x^2 + _{{k+l*j}}_x + _{{l*k}}_} \\[-3pt] \underline{x^3+_{j}_x^2+_{k}_x\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{l}_x^2+_{{l*j}}_x+_{{k*l}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{l}_x^2+_{{l*j}}_x+_{{l*k}}_}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] 0\,\,\,\end{array}\)
We get the remainder as 0 , therefore \(x+_{l}_\) is a factor of \(x^3 + _{{j+l}}_x^2 + _{{k+l*j}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ \)
also \((x+_{l}_)\times x^2+_{j}_x+_{k}_= x^3 + _{{j+l}}_x^2 + _{{k+l*j}}_x + _{{l*k}}_\)

content.text: Find whether \(x^2+_{j}_x+_{k}_\) is a factor of \(x^3 + _{{j+l}}_x^2 + _{{k+l*j}}_x + _{{l*k}}_ \) or not.
